title: 32 Funny Feline Memes for Overworked & Underpaid Who Mentally Clocked Out in 2012
description: Oh, Wednesdays. How you love to play with us. On one hand, when we reach you, we know that the week is halfway over. On the other hand, we know that we still have half of the week left. Not like it really matters to us, we checked out on Tuesday. Sure, we're here in the office, but mentally, we're at home cuddling with our cute cats and binging our current obsession on Netflix (we only have one episode left of Squid Games). That's why we're scrolling through some furbulously funny cat memes instead of actually working (even though our job is to scroll through memesâ€¦.you get what we're saying).These memes are for all you overworked & underpaid employees who mentally clocked out in 2012. If you like to spend your hours in your cubicle watching random Youtube videos while sending the occasional email, you're going to love these fluffy felines in meme form. You don't even have to like cats to laugh at them, but who doesn't like cats nowadays? Anyway, you can scroll down to the memes now. Or not, it's your choice.
author: Blake Seidel
excerpt: 32 Funny Feline Memes for Overworked & Underpaid Who Mentally Clocked Out in 2012 - World's largest collection of cat memes and other animals
text: Listen, once we give the advice, we don't take any responsibility for your actions. It was your choice to listen to our advice, we didn't force you to act on it. Anyway, we're already on the plane to Mexico, so good luck finding us. Everything happens for a reason, right? With the impending fall of capitalism and the rising prices of tuna, it makes sense that even cats these days are starting to pick up unhealthy coping mechanisms. Don't let your cats do anything you wouldn't do. Not that they're very susceptible to peer pressure anyway, but we don't want them taking any chances. They only have 9 lives.
html:
Listen, once we give the advice, we don't take any responsibility for your actions. It was your choice to listen to our advice, we didn't force you to act on it. Anyway, we're already on the plane to Mexico, so good luck finding us. Everything happens for a reason, right?

With the impending fall of capitalism and the rising prices of tuna, it makes sense that even cats these days are starting to pick up unhealthy coping mechanisms. Don't let your cats do anything you wouldn't do. Not that they're very susceptible to peer pressure anyway, but we don't want them taking any chances. They only have 9 lives.
